page.title: 07Historical sites in Wroxall.
page.content: If you would like to see historical places in Wroxall then you can go to Appuldurcombe House, the Obelisk, Capers,Manor Farm, Cooks Castle and Free Mantle Gates. Appuldurcombe House is the biggest and the best place to go to. On Appulducombe Down to the west of Appulducombe Park is the {Obelisk.}It was once 70 feet high but was badly damaged by lightning in 1831.It was built by Sir Richard Worsley in 1774 in memory of his relative Sir Robert.Now it is 18 feet high,and was rebuilt in 1983 by General Sir Richard Worsley. Godshill Parish Council is looking through its records to find out when Sir Robert Worsley died because there are two different dates on the Obelisk.
